text: for years American intelligence agencies
have been looking for evidence that Iran
has a secret nuclear site a place where
could enrich uranium to make bomb fuel
out of the site of nuclear inspectors
those inspectors of course has spent a
lot of time at Natanz the giant
underground facility that was first
discovered in 2002 and then belatedly
declared by the Iranians after they had
hidden the program for 18 years but
today inspectors crawl over that
facility every few weeks so it's not
really a good place for the Iranians to
produce fuel that could be used for
weapons or try to divert it to another
place with the revelation last night
that the Iranians do in fact have a
second facility one that's not yet
completed we now are beginning to
understand how Iran may have been
thinking about going about its weapons
program it could use this other facility
as long as it wasn't discovered to
produce maybe one bombs worth of
material a year and take what it learned
at Natanz and transfer it over to this
facility which is very deep in a
mountain in the religious city of quam
the new facility which President Obama
president Sarkozy of France and Prime
Minister Brown of Great Britain
announced this morning has not yet been
inspected by the IAEA so from this point
forward the international inspectors are
going to demand immediate access hoping
to get in fast enough that Iran does not
have a chance to dismantle what's
already inside but the bottom line is
that Iran has now been sort of thrown
back on its heels will be on the
defensive and with a lot of questions to
answer when the negotiations with the US
the first in 30 years start next
Thursday in Europe that could be a very
short negotiating session or it could
force the Iranians to begin to answer
questions that they have long resisted
this is david sanger for the new york
times
